data_pins.docs:
**list of pins**: The data lanes of the camera, this must be a list of 8 GPIO pins.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

vsync_pin.docs:
**pin**: The pin the VSYNC line of the camera is connected to.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

href_pin.docs:
**pin**: The pin the HREF line of the camera is connected to.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

pixel_clock_pin.docs:
**pin**: The pin the pixel clock line of the camera is connected to.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.docs:
**pin**: The pin the external clock line is connected to.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.docs:
**float**: The frequency of the external clock, must be between 10 and 20MHz. Defaults to `20MHz`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

external_clock.docs:
The configuration of the external clock to drive the camera.
  * **pin** (**Required**, pin): The pin the external clock line is connected to.
  
  * **frequency** (*Optional*, float): The frequency of the external clock, must be between 10 and 20MHz. Defaults to `20MHz`.
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

sda.docs:
**pin**: The SDA pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOD`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

scl.docs:
**pin**: The SCL pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOC`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

i2c_pins.docs:
The I²C control pins of the camera.
  * **sda** (**Required**, pin): The SDA pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOD`.
  
  * **scl** (**Required**, pin): The SCL pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOC`.
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

reset_pin.docs:
**pin**: The ESP pin the reset pin of the camera is connected to. If set, this will reset the camera before the ESP boots.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

power_down_pin.docs:
**pin**: The ESP pin to power down the camera. If set, this will power down the camera while it is inactive.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

resolution.docs:
**enum**: The resolution the camera will capture images at. Higher resolutions require more memory, if there’s not enough memory you will see an error during startup.
  * `160x120` (QQVGA, 4:3)
  
  * `176x144` (QCIF, 11:9)
  
  * `240x176` (HQVGA, 15:11)
  
  * `320x240` (QVGA, 4:3)
  
  * `400x296` (CIF, 50:37)
  
  * `640x480` (VGA, 4:3, default)
  
  * `800x600` (SVGA, 4:3)
  
  * `1024x768` (XGA, 4:3)
  
  * `1280x1024` (SXGA, 5:4)
  
  * `1600x1200` (UXGA, 4:3)
  
  * `1920x1080` (FHD, 16:9)
  
  * `720x1280` (Portrait HD, 9:16)
  
  * `864x1536` (Portrait 3MP, 9:16)
  
  * `2048x1536` (QXGA, 4:3)
  
  * `2560x1440` (QHD, 16:9)
  
  * `2560x1600` (WQXGA, 8:5)
  
  * `1080x1920` (Portrait FHD, 9:16)
  
  * `2560x1920` (QSXGA, 4:3)
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

jpeg_quality.docs:
**int**: The JPEG quality that the camera should encode images with. From 10 (best) to 63 (worst). Defaults to `10`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

contrast.docs:
**int**: The contrast to apply to the picture, from -2 to 2. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

brightness.docs:
**int**: The brightness to apply to the picture, from -2 to 2. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

saturation.docs:
**int**: The saturation to apply to the picture, from -2 to 2. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

vertical_flip.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to flip the image vertically. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

horizontal_mirror.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to mirror the image horizontally. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

GRAYSCALE.docs: Only luminance of picture is kept

SEPIA.docs: Sepia effect is applied to picture

special_effect.docs:
**enum**: The effect to apply to the picture. Defaults to `none` (picture without effect).
  * `none`: Picture without effect
  
  * `negative`: Colors of picture are inverted
  
  * `grayscale`: Only luminance of picture is kept
  
  * `red_tint`: Picture appear red-tinted
  
  * `green_tint`: Picture appear green-tinted
  
  * `blue_tint`: Picture appear blue-tinted
  
  * `sepia`: Sepia effect is applied to picture
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

MANUAL.docs: Gain can be manually set, with **agc_value** parameter. **agc_gain_ceiling** has no effect here

AUTO.docs: Camera manage sensor gain automatically. Maximum gain can be defined, thanks to **agc_gain_ceiling** parameter. **agc_value** has no effect here

agc_mode.docs:
**enum**: The mode of gain control module. Defaults to `auto` (leave camera to automatically adjust sensor gain).
  * `manual`: Gain can be manually set, with **agc_value** parameter. **agc_gain_ceiling** has no effect here
  
  * `auto`: Camera manage sensor gain automatically. Maximum gain can be defined, thanks to **agc_gain_ceiling** parameter. **agc_value** has no effect here
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

aec2.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to enable Auto Exposure Control 2. Seems to change computation method of automatic exposure. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

ae_level.docs:
**int**: The auto exposure level to apply to the picture (when **aec_mode** is set to `auto`), from -2 to 2. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

aec_value.docs:
**int**: The Exposure value to apply to the picture (when **aec_mode** is set to `manual`), from 0 to 1200. Defaults to `300`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

MANUAL.docs: Exposure can be manually set, with **aec_value** parameter. **ae_level** has no effect here

AUTO.docs: Camera manage exposure automatically. Compensation can be applied, thanks to **ae_level** parameter. **aec_value** has no effect here

aec_mode.docs:
**enum**: The mode of exposure module. Defaults to `auto` (leave camera to automatically adjust exposure).
  * `manual`: Exposure can be manually set, with **aec_value** parameter. **ae_level** has no effect here
  
  * `auto`: Camera manage exposure automatically. Compensation can be applied, thanks to **ae_level** parameter. **aec_value** has no effect here
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

agc_value.docs:
**int**: The gain value to apply to the picture (when **aec_mode** is set to `manual`), from 0 to 30. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

2X.docs: Camera is less sensitive, picture is clean (without visible noise)

128X.docs: Camera is more sensitive, but picture contain lot of noise

agc_gain_ceiling.docs:
**enum**: The maximum gain allowed, when **agc_mode** is set to `auto`. This parameter seems act as “ISO” setting. Defaults to `2x`.
  * `2x`: Camera is less sensitive, picture is clean (without visible noise)
  
  * `4x`
  
  * `8x`
  
  * `16x`
  
  * `32x`
  
  * `64x`
  
  * `128x`: Camera is more sensitive, but picture contain lot of noise
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

AUTO.docs: Camera choose best white balance setting

wb_mode.docs:
**enum**: The mode of white balace module. Defaults to `auto`.
  * `auto`: Camera choose best white balance setting
  
  * `sunny`: White balance sunny mode
  
  * `cloudy`: White balance cloudy mode
  
  * `office`: White balance office mode
  
  * `home`: White balance home mode
  
  

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

test_pattern.docs:
**boolean**: When enabled, the camera will show a test pattern that can be used to debug connection issues.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

max_framerate.docs:
**float**: The maximum framerate the camera will generate images at. Up to 60Hz is possible (with reduced frame sizes), but beware of overheating. Defaults to `10 fps`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

idle_framerate.docs:
**float**: The framerate to capture images at when no client is requesting a full stream. Defaults to `0.1 fps`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

frame_buffer_count.docs:
**int**: The number of frame buffers to use when reading from the camera sensor. Must be between 1 and 2.  Defaults to `1`.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

on_stream_start.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a stream starts.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

on_stream_stop.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a stream stops.

*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*
